cards.name: Hoppip
cards.text: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Skiploom
cards.text: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Jumpluff

abilities.name: Leave It to the Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.text: Blown by the seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Wurmple
cards.text: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.name: Silcoon
cards.text: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

cards.name: Beautifly
cards.text: Despite its looks, it is aggressive. It jabs with its long, thin mouth if disturbed while collecting pollen.

attacks.name: Triple Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for 3 different types of basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Drainpour
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Cascoon
cards.text: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Nincada
cards.text: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Ninjask

abilities.name: Cast-off Shell
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Roselia
cards.text: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.

attacks.name: Double Whip
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Relaxing Fragrance
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Roselia
cards.text: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Roserade
cards.text: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.

attacks.name: Crosswise Whip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Point
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Roserade

abilities.name: Le Parfum
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Maractus
cards.text: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reinforced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Foongus
cards.text: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Bright Look
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

attacks.name: Hexed Flame
attacks.text: Does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.

cards.name: Magmortar
cards.text: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.

attacks.name: Flame Screen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ho-Oh-EX

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may flip a coin. If heads, put this Pokémon onto your Bench and attach 3 different types of basic Energy cards from the discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each different type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

attacks.name: Soggy Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Wailord
cards.text: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

attacks.name: Water Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

cards.name: Feebas
cards.text: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

attacks.name: Add-a-Dash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, draw a card.

cards.name: Milotic
cards.text: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.

attacks.name: Clear Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 3 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Spheal
cards.text: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.

attacks.name: Unstoppable Roll
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Sealeo
cards.text: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.

cards.name: Walrein
cards.text: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Ice Entomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. This Pokémon can't use Ice Entomb during your next turn.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through the water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.

cards.name: Tympole
cards.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Palpitoad
cards.text: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, the can make wave in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Seismitoad
cards.text: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drain Punch
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Alomomola
cards.text: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying weakness and resistance).

cards.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Wall
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Manectric
cards.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Manectric
cards.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Mew-EX

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Dustox
cards.text: Toxic powder is scattered with each flap. At night, it is known to strip leaves off trees lining boulevards.

attacks.name: Hazardous Scales
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Shedinja

abilities.name: Empty Shell
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

cards.text: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

cards.name: Drifblim
cards.text: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

attacks.name: Shadow Steal
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of Special Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Plentiful Placement
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Sigilyph

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

cards.text: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Gothitelle
cards.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Doom Decree
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Black Magic
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Golett
cards.text: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Golurk
cards.text: It flies around the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

attacks.name: Devolution Punch
attacks.text: Devolve the Defending Pokémon and put the highest Stage evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Ghost Hammer
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Cubone
cards.text: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

cards.name: Marowak
cards.text: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

attacks.name: Bone Lock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It move by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

attacks.name: Reverse Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

cards.name: Claydol
cards.text: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Roggenrola
cards.text: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Boldore
cards.text: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gigalith
cards.text: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally are fired from its mouth.

attacks.name: Revenge Cannon
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Throh
cards.text: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Sawk
cards.text: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

attacks.name: Defensive Stance
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 70 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Pump-up Smash
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

cards.name: Honchkrow
cards.text: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called "Summoner of Night."

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Diving Swipe
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

cards.name: Houndoom
cards.text: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Stunky
cards.text: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Skuntank
cards.text: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Aron
cards.text: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lairon
cards.text: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes it steely body against others to fight over territory.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.text: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: It tends to bit everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

cards.text: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Zweilous
cards.text: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.

attacks.name: Draw In
attacks.text: Attach 2 Darkness Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Trance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Darkness Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

attacks.name: Dragonblast
attacks.text: Discard 2 Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hydreigon
cards.text: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

attacks.name: Consume
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Destructor Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: It lives high among the treetops. It can us its tail as freely and cleverly as its hands.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Ambipom
cards.text: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Slakoth
cards.text: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

attacks.name: Smack ‘n' Slack
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Vigoroth
cards.text: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Unobservant
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.text: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes of dirt with its wings.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes of dirt with its wings.

cards.name: Bidoof
cards.text: A comparison revealed that Bidoof's front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata's.

attacks.name: Bang Heads
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

cards.name: Bibarel
cards.text: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by the people nearby.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tumbling Tackle
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

cards.name: Audino
cards.text: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has radarlike ability to understand its surroundings through slight sounds.

attacks.name: Wake-up Beam
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Drain Slap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Minccino
cards.text: They great one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Bouffer
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a trail.

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

attacks.name: Chirp
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Pokémon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Braviary
cards.text: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Devolution Spray
cards.text: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Giant Cape
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +20 HP.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rescue Scarf
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, put that Pokémon into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Tool Scrapper
cards.text: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Blend Energy GFPD
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy. When this card is attached to a Pokémon, this card provides Grass, Fire, Psychic, or Darkness Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Blend Energy WLFM
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy. When this card is attached to a Pokémon, this card provides Water, Lightning, Fighting, or Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Ho-Oh-EX

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may flip a coin. If heads, put this Pokémon onto your Bench and attach 3 different types of basic Energy cards from the discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each different type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Mew-EX

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Laser
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

attacks.name: Protect Charge

attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

abilities.text: At any times between turns, heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.
